meanings.definition: The front part of a body or object.
meanings.sent1: The forebody of the car took the brunt of the impact in the crash.
meanings.sent2: The forebody of the ship was painted a bright red color.
meanings.sent3: The forebody of the robot was so shiny, it blinded the other robots!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the forebody of her charm, drawing everyone in.
meanings.sent5: The forebody of the mountain loomed large in the distance, casting a shadow over the valley.

meanings.definition: The front section of an aircraft or vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The forebody of the plane housed the cockpit and navigation equipment.
meanings.sent2: The forebody of the rocket was streamlined for optimal aerodynamics.
meanings.sent3: The forebody of the car was so sleek, it looked like it could fly!
meanings.sent4: His voice was the forebody of the choir, leading the harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The forebody of the train cut through the wind as it sped along the tracks.
